title: Max Crumpton
text:
Max Crumpton (born 25 October 1993) is an <a href="England">English</a> former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Harlequins%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> in <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">Premiership Rugby</a>.
He was a graduate of <a href="Saracens%20F.C.">Saracens</a> academy system where he progressed into the first-team squad. Crumpton spent time on loan with <a href="Plymouth%20Albion%20R.F.C.">Plymouth Albion</a> in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a> where he made four Championship appearances and featured in the <a href="British%20and%20Irish%20Cup">British and Irish Cup</a>. But it was cut short as he signed for Premiership rivals <a href="Harlequins%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> on a loan until the end of the 2013-14 season.
On 5 March 2014, Crumpton agreed a move to <a href="Bristol%20Bears">Bristol</a> who play in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a> on a two-year contract from the 2014-15 season. but was extended for two further seasons until the end of the 2017-18 season. However, on 5 February 2018, Crumpton left Bristol by mutual consent to resign with <a href="Harlequins%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> on a permanent deal until the end of the summer 2020.
Crumpton represented England through the age-group levels. He was selected for <a href="England%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">England U20s</a> squad to take part in the <a href="2012%20IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">2012 IRB Junior World Championship</a> in <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a> starting with a match against <a href="Italy%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy U20s</a> on 4 June 2012.
On 1 September 2018, Crumpton scored a try, on his competitive debut for <a href="Harlequins%20F.C.">Harlequins</a>. Quin's beat <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale</a> at home and Crumpton's second half try topped a brilliant competitive debut for Crumpton in <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">Premiership Rugby</a>, playing for Harlequins. 
He was forced to retire through injury in June 2020.
